intro: Sphaeromeria cana, commonly known as the white globemallow, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its globular, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid conditions. Its leaves are narrow and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Sphaeromeria cana is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and shrublands.
